title: the Ministers and Secretaries (Amendment) Act 1939 (No. 36 of 1939), hereby
heading: 1. (1) This Order may be cited as the Heritage (Transfer of Departmental
text_raw:
1. (1) This Order may be cited as the Heritage (Transfer of Departmental 

Administration and Ministerial Functions) Order 2020. 

(2) This Order comes into operation on 9 September 2020.
text_norm: 1 (1) order may cited heritage (transfer departmental administration ministerial functions) order 2020 (2) order come operation 9 september 2020

title: the Ministers and Secretaries (Amendment) Act 1939 (No. 36 of 1939), hereby
heading: 2. (1) The administration and business in connection with the exercise,
text_raw:
2. (1) The administration and business in connection with the exercise, 
performance or execution of any functions transferred by this Order are 
transferred to the Department of Housing, Planning and Local Government. 

(2) References to the Department of Culture, Heritage and the Gaeltacht 
contained in any Act or any instrument made thereunder and relating to any 
administration and business transferred by paragraph (1) shall, from the 
commencement of this Order, be construed as references to the Department of 
Housing, Planning and Local Government.
text_norm: 2 (1) administration business connection exercise performance execution function transferred order transferred department housing planning local government (2) reference department culture heritage gaeltacht contained act instrument made thereunder relating administration business transferred paragraph (1) shall commencement order construed reference department housing planning local government

title: the Ministers and Secretaries (Amendment) Act 1939 (No. 36 of 1939), hereby
heading: The functions vested in the Minister for Culture, Heritage and the
text_raw:
3. 

(1) 

The functions vested in the Minister for Culture, Heritage and the 
Gaeltacht by or under the Acts specified in Part 1 of the Schedule and the 
provisions of the Acts specified in Part 2 of the Schedule are transferred to the 
Minister for Housing, Planning and Local Government. 

(2) References to the Minister for Culture, Heritage and the Gaeltacht 
contained in any Act or instrument made thereunder and relating to any functions 
transferred by paragraph (1) shall, from the commencement of this Order, be 
construed as references to the Minister for Housing, Planning and Local 
Government.
text_norm: 3 (1) function vested minister culture heritage gaeltacht act specified part 1 schedule provision act specified part 2 schedule transferred minister housing planning local government (2) reference minister culture heritage gaeltacht contained act instrument made thereunder relating function transferred paragraph (1) shall commencement order construed reference minister housing planning local government

title: the Ministers and Secretaries (Amendment) Act 1939 (No. 36 of 1939), hereby
heading: 4. Where, immediately before the commencement of this Order, any legal
text_raw:
4. Where, immediately before the commencement of this Order, any legal 
proceedings are pending to which the Minister for Culture, Heritage and the 
Gaeltacht is a party and the proceedings have reference to functions transferred 
by this Order to the Minister for Housing, Planning and Local Government, the 
name of the Minister for Housing, Planning and Local Government shall, in so 
far as the proceedings relate to any function transferred by this Order, be 
substituted in the proceedings for that of the Minister for Culture, Heritage and 
the Gaeltacht or added in the proceedings, as may be appropriate, and the 
proceedings shall not abate by reason of such substitution.
text_norm: 4 immediately commencement order legal proceeding pending minister culture heritage gaeltacht party proceeding reference function transferred order minister housing planning local government name minister housing planning local government shall far proceeding relate function transferred order substituted proceeding minister culture heritage gaeltacht added proceeding may appropriate proceeding shall abate reason substitution

title: the Ministers and Secretaries (Amendment) Act 1939 (No. 36 of 1939), hereby
heading: 5. Anything commenced before the commencement of this Order by or
text_raw:
5. Anything commenced before the commencement of this Order by or 
under the authority of the Minister for Culture, Heritage and the Gaeltacht may, 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 11th September, 2020. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [339] 3 

in so far as it relates a function transferred by this Order to the Minister for 
Housing, Planning and Local Government, be carried on or completed from such 
commencement by the Minister for Housing, Planning and Local Government.
text_norm: 5 anything commenced commencement order authority minister culture heritage gaeltacht may notice making statutory instrument published iris oifigiuil 11th september 2020 339 3 far relates function transferred order minister housing planning local government carried completed commencement minister housing planning local government

title: the Ministers and Secretaries (Amendment) Act 1939 (No. 36 of 1939), hereby
heading: 6. Every document (including any certificate or licence) granted or made in
text_raw:
6. Every document (including any certificate or licence) granted or made in 
the performance of a function transferred by this Order shall, if and in so far as 
it was operative immediately before the commencement of this Order, have 
effect from such commencement as if it had been granted or made by the 
Minister for Housing, Planning and Local Government.
text_norm: 6 every document (including certificate licence) granted made performance function transferred order shall far operative immediately commencement order effect commencement granted made minister housing planning local government

title: the Ministers and Secretaries (Amendment) Act 1939 (No. 36 of 1939), hereby
heading: 7. References to the Minister for Culture, Heritage and the Gaeltacht
text_raw:
7. References to the Minister for Culture, Heritage and the Gaeltacht 
contained in the memorandum and articles of association of any company and 
relating to any function transferred by this Order shall, from the commencement 
of this Order, be construed as references to the Minister for Housing, Planning 
and Local Government.
text_norm: 7 reference minister culture heritage gaeltacht contained memorandum article association company relating function transferred order shall commencement order construed reference minister housing planning local government

title: the Ministers and Secretaries (Amendment) Act 1939 (No. 36 of 1939), hereby
heading: 8. (1) All property, rights and liabilities held, enjoyed or incurred before the
text_raw:
8. (1) All property, rights and liabilities held, enjoyed or incurred before the 
commencement of this Order by the Minister for Culture, Heritage and the 
Gaeltacht, in connection with the functions transferred by this Order are 
transferred to the Minister for Housing, Planning and Local Government and, 
accordingly, without any further conveyance, transfer or assignment, on such 
commencement - 

(a) 

(b) 

(c) 

that property, both real and personal, vests in the Minister for 
Housing, Planning and Local Government, 

those rights are rights of the Minister for Housing, Planning and 
Local Government, and 

those liabilities are liabilities of the Minister for Housing, 
Planning and Local Government. 

(2) All moneys, stocks, shares and securities transferred to the Minister for 
Housing, Planning and Local Government by this Article which, on the 
commencement of this Order, are standing in the name of the Minister for 
Culture, Heritage and the Gaeltacht shall, on the request of the Minister for 
Housing, Planning and Local Government, be transferred into the name of the 
Minister for Housing, Planning and Local Government. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [339]

title: the Ministers and Secretaries (Amendment) Act 1939 (No. 36 of 1939), hereby
heading: Article 3
text_raw:
SCHEDULE 

Part 1 

Article 3 

Irish Church Act 1869 (32 & 33 Vict. c. 42) 

National Monuments Act 1930 (No. 2 of 1930) (other than section 23(7)) 

Bourn Vincent Memorial Park Act 1932 (No. 31 of 1932) 

Whale Fisheries Act 1937 (No. 4 of 1937) 

National Monuments (Amendment) Act 1954 (No. 37 of 1954) 

Holycross Abbey (County Tipperary) Act 1969 (No. 7 of 1969) 

Wildlife Act 1976 (No. 39 of 1976) (other than section 59 in so far as it relates 
to foreshore which is the property of the State) 

National Monuments (Amendment) Act 1987 (No. 17 of 1987) 

National Monuments (Amendment) Act 1994 (No. 17 of 1994) (other than 
sections 3, 5(5), 6(2) and 10(1)) 

Heritage Act 1995 (No. 4 of 1995) 

Architectural Heritage 
(Miscellaneous Provisions) Act 1999 (No. 19 of 1999) 

(National 

Inventory) and Historic Monuments 

Wildlife (Amendment) Act 2000 (No. 38 of 2000) (other than sections 16 to 18) 

Heritage Fund Act 2001 (No. 44 of 2001) 

National Monuments (Amendment) Act 2004 (No. 22 of 2004) 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [339] 5 

Part 2 

Section 14 of the Irish Land Act 1903 (3 Edw. 7 c.37) 

Section 2(2) of the Ministers and Secretaries (Amendment) Act 1928 (No. 6 of 
1928) in so far as it relates to the Royal Botanic Gardens 

Section 482 of the Taxes Consolidation Act 1997 (No. 39 of 1997) 

Section 5 (in so far as it relates to the functions transferred by this Order) of the 
Minister for Arts, Heritage, Gaeltacht and the Islands (Powers and Functions) 
Act 1998 (No. 7 of 1998) 

Sections 20(1)(c) and 28 of the Prisons Act 2007 (No. 10 of 2007) 

GIVEN under the Official Seal of the Government, 

8 September, 2020. 

MICHEÁL MARTIN, 

Taoiseach.
